overview: This measure will address critical weaknesses in the current regulatory framework by establishing a dedicated adjudication system that will streamline the processing of fireworks infractions, allowing for more efficient enforcement and prosecution. [8] This measure will also establish a graduated penalty structure that appropriately reflects the severity of violations, particularly those resulting in serious injury or death, which serves as both a deterrent and an appropriate response to the harm caused. [8]
agency_impact: Your Committees have amended this measure by incorporating the fireworks violations adjudication process into the existing traffic and emergency procedure violations adjudication process within the Hawaii Revised Statutes. [8] The measure was also amended by deleting law enforcement officer from the definition of "inspector". [8] Further amendments specify that it shall be unlawful for any person to purchase, possess, or otherwise cause to explode any consumer fireworks without a permit, except that a person licensed may purchase or possess consumer fireworks in accordance with the person's license. [8]
policy_impact: A significant policy change in the amended measure incorporates the fireworks violations adjudication process into the existing traffic and emergency procedure violations adjudication process within the Hawaii Revised Statutes. [8] The measure now also clarifies that the counties are not prohibited from enacting ordinances pertaining to the issuance of fireworks permits that are more stringent than the restrictions found in the Hawaii Revised Statutes. [8] Additionally, the bill was amended to specify the offense of general fireworks or articles pyrotechnic prohibitions in the second degree if a person acts without a permit. [8]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The measure has been substantially amended to incorporate the fireworks violations adjudication process into the existing adjudication process for traffic and emergency procedure violations. [8] The definition of "inspector" has been changed by deleting "law enforcement officer". [8] The committees also made amendments to clarify lawful activities for licensed wholesalers and retailers and to specify unlawful actions for persons without a permit. [8] Updated testimony was received from the Hawaii State Fire Council, the Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the County of Maui, Phantom Fireworks, and TNT Fireworks. [8]
